title: It’s $40 for a lifetime license to Microsoft Office for Macs
content:
Macworld

Have you seen how expensive it is just to have a basic Microsoft 365 subscription? If you’re not using every single part of it, then there’s no reason not to jump on a cheaper alternative like this Microsoft Office lifetime license. There aren’t any recurring fees, and it’s only $39.99 (reg. $229). 

What’s included?

This suite comes with the works. That includes Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote, and Teams Classic, all optimized for Macs. 

You can install each of these apps on one computer one time, so choose wisely. After that, they’re yours for life, whether you need a better app for writing up a resume or run your entire professional life out of Excel like the rest of the world. 

So why is it so cheap? This is the 2019 version of Office, and it doesn’t have all the bells and whistles of the most recent updates. That may actually be a good thing for people running older computers. It’s an easy trade if you’re sick of paying monthly for Microsoft 365. 

You have until December 22 to get a lifetime license for Microsoft Office Home and Business for Mac for $39.99.
